alert.note: Alert for Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 11 at 9:54PM EDT until September 12 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR LEOMINSTER... The National Weather Service in Norton has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Worcester County in central Massachusetts... * Until 800 AM EDT Tuesday. * At 954 PM EDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in emergency manager reports roadways being washed out and flood waters entering homes and business. . Between 6 and 9 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Leominster. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Leominster, Fitchburg, Lunenburg, Lancaster, Sterling, Westminster, Shirley and Princeton. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
